name: FarSky
description: FarSky is a short survival game in the depths of the Ocean. Collect all the pieces of your submarine and reach back the surface.
minimum_requirements: OS: XP or later Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo, AMD Athlon X2, or equal at 1.6GHz or better Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: Dedicated graphics card (OpenGL 2.0) Storage: 500 MB available space Additional Notes: Java required

reviews.review_text: It was fun for a couple hours. Buy Subnautica instead.

This game is basically Minecraft but underwater. You can harvest resources like seaweed, fertilizer, dirt, sand, coal, iron, copper, gold, silver, crystals (they're just called crystals), and turn them to weapons, equipment, furniture, and buildings.   Here are the differences between Minecraft and FarSky in terms of gameplay, not art: - Your tools and equipment (including armor) never break (very handy) since you need only three primary tools - You have three main tools: knife to cut or attack, harpoon (spear) gun, and drill (to harvest and mine all available resources, including sand) - You don't have to arrange items to create items. You just need to have the minimum resources to create and you can create how ever much you want.  - Oxygen. Your character can only be outside for a limited time before you need to head back to a base to regain oxygen. It doesn't take long to refill. - Bases. You can't just build a base with sand, floors, walls, etc. You need to make an item that builds a base.  - There is a plot. Which I will explain later. - Boss battles against a mother******in' KRAKEN. If you harvest their crystal they will attack you and your base until you die. Then they leave you alone.  Here are similarities: - Hunger, if your hunger is up 100% you will start taking damage.  - Mining resources and using those resources to make tools.  - Pretty music and visuals. - Predators that attack more frequently at night. Never before had I had such sastifaction of killing a shark (an endangered species IRL). Nor the frustration of being attacked and killed by a shark (and pretty much anything that bites, stings, shocks, touches you even a little bit. - Open world exploration. You can explore deeper parts of the ocean when you have the advanced equipment to go deeper.   Plot: You are Nathan, a deep sea explorer of the coast of Austrialia, since everything underwater is out to kill you (including the jellyfish). For some reason, your submarine breaks apart into 9 pieces that scattered across the map. Your task is to get back all those parts and survive. You will have another researcher that will guide you and help you (a little bit). For the most part, you jump into the game with little to no help. Once you collect the 9 parts, you instantly rebuild your submarine and you can take it to the surface where you beat the game.  Once you beat the game, you can play sandbox mode.  What's missing: - Bed or something to make it speed up time until morning. - Some kind of radar to detect enemies. You can get attacked at all sides and no idea where they are coming from, how many, then you die. - More story or tasks. I like that there is something more than surviving. Maybe look for lost treasure or something. - More creative ability like in Minecraft to build and do whatever you want.  8/10.

This game was an amazing experence but it suffers from lack of content. I really wish this game hadnt been abandoned. It is way to short even if it is enjoyable. I hope someone will add more content in the future

I used to play this game in both the Alpha & Beta stages. It had much potentional; howbeit when the game was Greenlit, everything had been rushed and from what I believed to be.... incompleted. Through out the time things were being added & taken away. Many of the things taken away were very valuable pieces that would've brought this game to life. The bosses, the oil resource, the leveling up, & etc were taken out. I hope Tim Speckler the developer would complete this game just as it rightfully deserves to be completed. As for comparing to Subnautica, well Subnautica had a whole crew whereas Farysky was a one man army deal, plus Farsky came out before Subnautica. Well, that's my two cents.
Subnautica is 1000% better than this game

It's horrifying to think that although humans rule the earth, we are totally outclassed in the sea. This is the pivot that FarSky works on. You are a survivor of a submarine crash and need to survive long enough to retrieve the pieces of your craft and make it to safety.  You learn to watch your oxygen. Your hunger. Your injuries. Depth. Daylight. Materials. Predators. There's a tight little game here.  Unfortunately the experience is a little shallow. Building your base is fun, but beyond the crafting tables and a small crop of vegetables, there's not a lot to do. Exploration is mandatory and soon enough you get into the gameplay loop of guessing when it's dawn, scooting out to find a little more resources, or travel a little further down. The world is procedurally generated, so that's both fun and frustrating in equal measures.  It's probably a nice game to play for a weekend. Music is nice and the graphics are at times stunning despite their simplicity. With a little more gameplay or variety, this could be quite a refreshing alternative to Minecraft, but lacks the complexity and creativity.

After beating adventure and survivor mode and explored everywhere and even started going to max depths to see what else is there and trying not to die and trying to kill as many Krakens I can, but it does get boring pretty quickly. I hope maybe someday the dev may release source code or allow modding. It is a good game with a ton of potential, and it's pretty good for a rainy day. It is worth giving this game a try when it go's on sale.
The devloper quit on this game its not worth a buy because it is SHALLOW. haha get it? no but really dont get it. Just get subnautica :)

I bought FarSky on a whim. I had some extra cash to spare and the concept of the game looked compelling enough for me. Since I've finished the initial 'campaign mission'/'adventure mode'. I think I'm qualified to review the game.   GRAPHICS (9/10):  I was hooked by the graphics in FarSky. I'm serious, the game looks great. It doesn't sink into the 'box/block aesthetic' that most voxel-based sandbox survival games like to fall into. For a game built on Java, it looks pretty fantastic. If there's anything that this game does great it's the graphics. It's appropriately minimalistic when it needs to and appropriately detailed when it needs to. No two landscapes look the same, and while there are certain patterns as to where things appear—these patterns never look too obvious.  While textures might fade in and out sometimes—the game's still in a early dev stage and it's probably a problem that will be fixed later in a patch or something.    SOUNDTRACK/SOUND EFFECTS (7/10):  The music does a good job in setting a tone for the game. A good word to describe the soundtrack for the majority of the game is 'melancholic'. It's peaceful and it's never too distracting. I would however, hope for more suspenseful tunes for the game during moments where the player is in trouble.   Sound effect wise, the game is pretty quiet. Whilst the game itself is understandably quiet (it's set underwater...and sound doesn't travel well), the lack of sound effects make the game sometimes feel boring. I'm not saying that the game should be a smorgashboard of sounds—but it would be nice if we heard the occaisional whale call or maybe the periodical breathing of our main character. Or maybe even a low and steady hum of the drill you use.    CONTROLS (8/10):  FarSky's your bog-standard survival/voxel-based game. It handles a lot like MineCraft. I'd say that it does a pretty good job at what it's supposed to do—only for a few issues.   1) In other games of similar nature, you're usually allowed to right click on resources or to split resources the way you want them. In FarSky, you can only fill a certain resource up to the maximum amount and that's it. There are no 'resource distribution' controls built in the game and that can be quite frustrating.  2) The swimming mechanics are kind of clunky. And for some reason—you can't crouch! I'm hoping that the 'no crouching' problem could be fixed later in DLC.   GAMEPLAY (7/10):  For what it has so far, it's pretty good. I mean, it's fun. And it will definitely kill six hours (that's how long it took me to beat the first 'adventure mode') and the game has everything that it's advertised to have. You can build bases underwater, you can mine for resources underwater, you can hunt for fishes...et, cetera. There's nothing missing!  But while it's everything it's advertised to be, there aren't enough features! I'm hoping that the devs release periodic updates a la Minecraft and allow for modding support, because this game needs more content to kill more than six hours! I'll probably revisit the game sometime later, but the lack of content is kind-of a turnoff. You'd think that a game that focuses heavily on underwater exploration would have more stuff to explore right?    OVERALL (7.5/10):  I don't regret purchasing FarSky. But I just want more content. I don't care if the devs don't fix the 'no crouching' problem, I just want more music, more sound effects and more gameplay elements.   As of the time I'm writing this review, this game is on sale—and it's worth the buy right now. That's if the devs add stuff. If they don't add any new features within the next few months following the posting of this review. Don't buy the game. But if you're going to buy the game now, buy it—it's worth it. And at the very least, it will kill 6 hours of your time.

I really wish there was something in between yes and no but well, I will have to say no. The reason is simply because of price and content, this game cost's the same price as Subnautica and yet it does not have anywhere near as much content to boot. Subnautica is a game that I highly recommend but far sky isn't. If far sky goes on sale for a cheap price then sure go buy it but if it doesn't, get Subnautica instead. Also think about this. Subnautica is in early access and far sky is 'finished' and yet Subnautica has way more content, just let your brain process that.  EDIT: I found out that the game is actually cheaper than Subnautica now? I guess that's good?

Great game. Loads of fun on it;however, the devs seem to have give up on it. Lots of potential put to waste. I thought it was early access until i saw otherwise. Its about 3-4 hours of fun max until you see how empty and limited the game is. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS (unless it starts to be updated again). If this game is on sale for 2-3 USD, its a good find, if not, its a waste.

Interesting concept but is unfinished. Its pretty, to an extent, but is very easy and very limited.  You can complete the entire 'game' in a little over an hour. And if I had known about SubNautica before I had bought this, I definitley would've spent my money on that.
A clunky version of Subnautica. Looks great but not worth 9.99

The potential was there but ultimately this game drowns in a shallow pool of content  The game gives you everything you could possibly craft in the first 5 minutes of the game, guides you to the 9 submarine pieces, thanks you for playing and sends you home. Sure you could stay behind and hunt down the ore needed for tier 3 armour and farm resources to create a bigger base but what for? There's no secrets or anything worthy of finding besides the underwhelming kraken and the resources he guards. If you do find yourself exploring you'll soon find there's no penalty to dying making enemies non threatening and the air and food gauge pointless.  Overall it's pretty to look at for 10 minutes but not for £10

I Only got one thing to say, i fricking love underwater games, i just love them.   Now let's be serious, In my point of side, is one of the best games i ever saw in my entire life, im not even joking, you should be getting this game right away.  Even tho, it hurts my heart, that i have to say.. that this game is.. 'copletelly' finished.. There's not gonna be an update for FarSky.. It really hurts me, seeing this game as it is, and not even update it, you can go up to -350 underwater! But you helmet breaks if you descend more than that, the final 'boss' is AWESOME, I Hope at some poinnt of this game, it makes an update, a really big one, i have hopes in this game.

Remember the days when you got a Demo cd with your local Pc gaming magazine? An incomplete, single level with limited options but just enough to get you interested in buying the full game?  This is EXACTLY what the game is...except there is no finished game, just this demo model being charged at the price of a full game.  Be sure to play under 2 hours to get a full refund.

Bought this game when it first came out and ever since then i was hoping that there will be more things added to the game after a couple months but sadly that wasnt the case. Played the game for a couple hours beat it then got bored. This lacks so much content, Subnautica has alot more things in it and devs still adding more stuffs.
Wish they'd update it. Unlikely to happen, though.

This game is absolutely wonderful. It's so simple yet so deep (Haha... Water puns). Wonderfully atmospheric, the music is a joy to listen too. Sadly, what is out at this moment may be what we have for a long time. As the game isn't in Early Acess so new content may be a lost cause. Still a wonderful buy.

In all honesty, it's cool at first. The only problem is it was abandoned by the developers, and barely works. When it does turn on everything is black, and when it doesn't it usually crashes everything.

I can only recommend it under heavy discount (I myself bought it along with a bunch of other games on bundlestars(dot)com) and, with that price, it's a fair purchase - it is a small survival experience with fairly intuitive UI, compressed in 2-3 hours worth of content that I really enjoyed (then there's basically nothing else to do, except for hunting for more materials you already have and expanding the base that you don't really have to do).  The only thing that stops me from just buying Subnautica is its 'Early Access' state, but even at the moment for just 10 bucks more it will provide you significantly much more content, more polished graphics, compared to FarSky, so keep that in mind.
Excellent game. Nicely balanced and kept me interested. Not too big or too small. Recommend this.
Had a blast diving around the underwater environment. The game is a lot of fun but very short (can be finished in just one day). I look forward to future updates.
Great game, unfortunately very short, and once it was released the developer decided to just let it die.
Great game just a shame there haven't been updates in ages

I really love this game. I already played it through once and then bought it for myself and played through it again. It is so good, so relaxing, so beautiful. It is not a game with super realistic graphics, but the colors, the enviornment, the music, the system of it, all is great. It is a short game and leaves you wanting more, but that is the beauty of it. It knows its points and works on them. I finished the game much faster on my second playthrough since I already knew all the right things to do. But there is so much fun to have with this game. IT is just a masterpiece that deserves more recognition.

I love this game, It's basic, easy to understand and then easy to complete. Yes the story is relatively if for just go HAM on resource gathereing. Sandbox mode has been my main time playing though. I don't think this deserves sp any bad reviews just because of subnautica being the bigger, more polished game.
Good game with a nice concept. Adventure mode is short. Overall good game. I just wish there were more things to do and craft.

Good game I think a few things should be added though.  --Glass Flooring Tiles  --Ability to change colors of interior walls of base, I'd say different colors based off the type of materials you have at the moment...  --Fish nests throughout the areas of the map.  --Deep dark underwater caves to explore.  --More fish species.  --The random schools of fish that swim about have them tighter together, to me that would be much better.  --Have strong weather effects on the surface for visual effects.  --Have random boats speed by on the surface.  My opinion if those were added the game would be allot better, but it is pretty good how it is in itself.  Rate 9/10

Might not look like the best survival game at first glance but its definitely worth the buy. A very peaceful yet challenging game at times. Its great if you like immersive solo survival kinda games, or if you just want to kill some time. Good game regardless :)
This is a unique game like minecraft mixed with Sir, you are being hunted its really just a good game
♥♥♥♥, got confused... thought this was Farcry? My bad...
really good game i like it alot but you have to get into it first definently get this first if your considering getting subnautica.

A fresh new take on the open world sandbox type games. I just wish that there was more to do and that the story took longer to complete. Altogether I could see this game being a prime example of the perfect game to load up with tons of mods. If you could also customize your suit besides getting different materials that would be great.
not a fun game at all very boring and stupid
This is a really good game, but it runs out of content to quickly.
Its fun to play if your not going for content.
boaring its fun on start but than you understand that its all u can do me personally have reqested a refund

When i first bought this game i had very high expectations for it after looking at multiple reviews. I launched the game fine and played it for a few hours. I was very surprise at how well running it was and how smooth it was. The graphics are great and reflect cartoon 3d minecraft. I completed the game in a few hours which i felt was quite quick. I stopped playing it for about a week and then decided to go on it again. I launched the game and clicked play. The loading screen came up for about a second and then crashed. I tried uninstalling and reinstalling and tried again but to no avail. Pros: .Great graphics .Fun gameplay .Awsome free roam. .Amazing Building capabilities Cons: .I cant run it. .There are far better underwater exploring games out there such as stranded deep and subnautica. .Very infrequent updates .Very short game Overall i would encourage you to buy this title but because of the glitch where i canot run it i would recommend spending your money somewhere else.

This game is so fun to play, I love going around finding and crafing resources to expand my base, and exploring, finding abandoned bases and ship parts. I have not gone to the very deep yet, or found all submarine parts, but so far this game is an absolute blast to play. The graphics are not so great for late 2016, and I have not heard or seen anything like octopuses and squids or great white sharks and any vehicles besides two ( not including the drone ), but I still love to play this. My rating: 7/10, recommended for those who like underwater survival games.

If this game came out in early 2000s it would have been amazing. However for 2014 it was graphically behind the times. Feels like a 1st gen alpha creation that never got completed. Once it was released there was no new development and no updates pending.

while the dev has concided this game to be complet and finished it is still lacking and has a lot of room for improvent also it needs more things to do/build for the sandbox portion of it to be worth playing the storyline part is good but once you play through the story line realy the only thing left to do is sandbox and the lack of stuff to do in sandbox makes it not worth it

Simply amazing, for a few hours, and then will never be replayed, had amazing potential, but was a cash grab, sold loads, and then the devs left it, it feels empty and incomplete, simply no replay value to it at all, If it goes on sale for around £1 i'd say purchase it, but above that i dont feel you'll ever get your money out of it

Despite being only singleplayer , the game is quite enjoyable very peaceful, until the Kraken get a hold of you.  Game progression is a little too quick for my pace , and they need to add more items for construction.  Altogether Fun,would recommend the game

I'm not one for commenting on games but I do have to comment on this one, as it just has so much more to give it’s just a crying shame. The game is a good concept an underwater building game that is very limited on what you can build/create and explore it’s just unfortunate the creator won't be doing anymore updates as there just isn't enough in the game.   My suggestion is this if you don’t want to update the game anymore allow the modders to update it through steam workshop, we will then see the true potential of this game. As I said it's good start to the game but it needs more.
A beautiful game, with a little crafting, exploration, action and survival all mixed together. However, the full price is too high. Wait for a 50-75% discount sale before getting it.

Farsky is amazing for the first few hours. But after that it will become boring because it has not too many items, monsters, things to do ingame and the dev said he is done with the game. So don't expect anything new in the game. I would reccomend buying this game on sale. As of writing this review atm there is a 80% sale and I would say buy it now! If you can. I would give Farsky a 7/10 I would give it higher if it had more items/things to do ingame

I bought it on sale, I suggest you do too cause if you like creating big bases and being the best around then this is for you but I finished the main 'story' in one sitting. Anyone who likes exploration and the beauty of the deep sea you should buy, but only when its on sale. I recommend the game, but its not worth the money.

This game is far from finished. Too bad development has been abandoned - it had so much potenital. Oh well, next time I'm not gonna throw my money on another indie game without reviewing it thouroughly. I practically went from not knowing anthing about the game, to having explored and tried everything and amassing several huge bases in under 3 hours. Playing after that just felt... unecessary end repetitive.

It's short in length and not long on replay value but fun and unique. I picked it up on a whim and was quite surprised to find a very simple but engaging world. FarSky feels like a dimestore sci-fi novel made virtual. Yes it's a sandbox survival blah blah . . . try it anyway!   If you are tempted to ask 'But how does he eat fish with his helmet on?' this game is likely not for you.
after one night you are already bored  but its ok

Great game for the price. This game could have become so much more, with a story or deeper ocean levels, but as it currently stands it's still a lot of fun with it's own challenges until you get the hang of it. Random map generation makes each play through easier or harder, and you can select from various modes like open sandbox or to 'win' the game by collecting all the right parts.
I wouldn't buy this one again. Just kinda trails off where a survival game really ought to be getting started.

When I first saw the trailer for the game I was blown away by the concept and unique setting presented, and bought it right then. I have been playing crafting/survival games for awhile now am hooked on the genre. I tend to play horror games a lot also so when they are combined (like in 7 days to die) there is a good formula for a game. But as far as horror games go no amount of zombies or mutilated aliens or jump scares or screaming bloody murder is truly scary. The reason being is that games and movies have been all over those settings for a long time, and they have become a big repetitive. Zombies, aliens, obscene amounts of gore, thats old material.  Now, what isn't old material:deep, dark oceans, drowning, massive sea monsters, and whatever that feeling is that everyone had when they were a kid and they swam in the deep end of the swimming pool, afraid somehow there was a massive shark or octopus underneath you.  FarSky takes advantage of these fears, and combined with it's unique setting makes for a perfect formula of a game that fulfills the void left by the fact that there has not been any kind of game like it. Deep ocean has got to be the best grounds for a survival game there is. I just finished the game and have got to say it was fun, really fun, especially when I was running (swimming) for my life trying to get into my base before a shark ripped my arm off. And the bone chilling feeling of fragile safety being inside of my base looking out the windows at the dark, scary ocean and seeing hordes of dangerous fish really made me feel immersed in the game. Knowing that a piece of glass was all that protected you from an infinite expanse of your worst childhood nightmares was nice feature, and Jumping off an undersea cliff really gave me a feeling of adventure. Also it got me immediately thinking about all the horrible sea monsters that could be below me, which got me thinking I need to get back to my base and go back to that feeling of safety that felt so good. I give this game a well deserved 10/10.
Thought being in the water was bad in FarCry? Think again.. 10/10 would scream again

When I first saw the trailer for the game I was blown away by the concept and unique setting presented, and bought it right then. I have been playing crafting/survival games for awhile now am hooked on the genre. I tend to play horror games a lot also so when they are combined (like in 7 days to die) there is a good formula for a game. But as far as horror games go no amount of zombies or mutilated aliens or jump scares or screaming bloody murder is truly scary. The reason being is that games and movies have been all over those settings for a long time, and they have become a big repetitive. Zombies, aliens, obscene amounts of gore, thats old material.  Now, what isn't old material:deep, dark oceans, drowning, massive sea monsters, and whatever that feeling is that everyone had when they were a kid and they swam in the deep end of the swimming pool, afraid somehow there was a massive shark or octopus underneath you.  FarSky takes advantage of these fears, and combined with it's unique setting makes for a perfect formula of a game that fulfills the void left by the fact that there has not been any kind of game like it. Deep ocean has got to be the best grounds for a survival game there is. I just finished the game and have got to say it was fun, really fun, especially when I was running (swimming) for my life trying to get into my base before a shark ripped my arm off. And the bone chilling feeling of fragile safety being inside of my base looking out the windows at the dark, scary ocean and seeing hordes of dangerous fish really made me feel immersed in the game. Also it got me immediately thinking about all the horrible sea monsters that could be below me, which got me thinking I need to get back to my base and go back to that feeling of safety that felt so good. I give this game a well deserved 10/10.
Too quick. You can finish it in one day and after a while there's nothing to do. I've only played a couple hours and already finished and seen all there is to see. Glad I only paid $3 for this game.

The only postive I can think about this game is the fact it is underwater and that is awesome. But unfortunately this game is really very weak. It takes only about 3 hours, give or take, to finish it by getting the submarine and returning to the surface and there is not much meat on it bones. You can easily gather enough resource to craft a rediculous amount of high tier object which only means you need and insanly large storage facility to store them as there is not enough object variety to craft that would warrent being able to deplete your large resource stockpile. Even the high tier items are limited to being about maybe 10 things in total. The map, while randomly generated is actually small it takes about a minute or so just to cross from one end to the other, even going to the lowest depth possible isn't very rewarding as it is pretty much like the top level, lots of light with lots of undersea plants. If your looking for a game that is good for killing small amounts of time then this game might be for you if your willing to pay $15 for what little you get.  I would get a refund if I knew it were possible.

I honestly wanted to recommend this game - because there are aspects that I liked - but I cannot.   First and foremost my save game became corrupted after 3 hours of playing, and that did it. There's lost of other bugs in this game, like sharks spawning out of nowhere next to you and killing you in one bite, bugs in crafting and so on. Feels like an Early Access pushed out because the developer got bored or something.   Secondly, the whole concept if this game is ridiculous and perverted. I wanted to say that the author has no understanding of even the simplest concept of school-level physics, but it is much more worse - they do not even understand how water and swimming works, least of all, how swimming under the water might be working.  The whole game is based on the premise that the protagonist's submarine is broken (in pieces, no less) and so they are stuck underwater, because they cannot JUMP high enough to reach the surface! So we have to craft a base to survive underwater and actually go DEEPER to gather pieces of the broken up submarine, so it can bring us back up and above. Because, I repeat, when you are deep underwater, you can only walk and jump and hold that electrical thing that moves you fast. But it can't move you to the surface either. Not to mention that we're walking and jumping at depths that would be completely rid of color and light, and not survivable by a human on it's own, but that just some geek details, right?  Maybe I am so picky about this because I have over 40 dives logged, but with all the bugs this is beyond ridiculous.
This Game is BAD
i finished the game in 1hour and it was amazing i loved it, its fun and very well made but its a shame that the game is that short... so i still recommend this game.
Since the Devs deleted my review i will say it again, i would rather drag my nuts across molten lava and broken glass dipped in arsenic than deal with this mess of a game
The game is great except the game keeps on shutting down on me.

This game is really amazing. Such a beautiful world, especially when you dive deeper down nto the depths of the ocean.  The graphics are really nice. The ocean looks and 'feels' great. The games survival mechanics are amazing considering the game takes place underwater.  A feeling of having a shark come up behind you at any given time to chomp you is so exhilarating. 9/10, beautiful and truly a great game.

great game, its not just a survival, Crafting, adventure game, its also a game where you can see the sea life form, you can go from a peacefull ocean to a deadly one, at night all the predators hunting or just see a school of fish going by, its prety relaxing at some moments and very exciting at others.

While this game was quite fun for the first day or two. It got old fast due to lack of content. You will most likely own all the items in the game within your first hour of playing. Seeing as this game no longer gets updates, I'd say spend your cash on something else.

This game is better than I thought it would be. Think of it as an underwater Minecraft, but with an actual goal to escape and a home already made for you to hide in. You can play it your own way by killing fish which attract sharks, or growing vegetables that take an eternity to sprout if you're desperate for food.\ I have to admit, walking about I tend to actually shriek when a sharks open jaws are coming straight for me! EDIT: DO NOT, I REPEAT, DO NOT BUILD A BASE, SHOOT A KRAKEN, THEN HIDE SMUGLY IN BASE.
AWESOMEEE  IT'S LIKE OCEAN SIMULATOR 2014  YOU GET TO LIVE UNDERWATER, AND TRY TO MAKE IT BACK TO SURFACE  THEY ARE LOTS OF ANIMALS AND PLANT LIFE  THIS GAME IS EPICCC  MUST BUY
I love this game it is fun, creepy, thrilling and it ticks all my boxes for the best game
Can any one HELP! cant get far sky to work becsuse of java. PLEASE HELP. WE have a Mac. Thanks

I'll happily amend this review if and when the game stops crashing when I hit the Play button. Apparently there are a number of people having the same problem, and some people are able to get it working after some serious workarounds. Unfortunately I am not one of those people.
i have not gone more than 10 minutes at a time playing this game because it crashes so frequently, which is really unfortunate because it sounds really good and i reeeally want to play.

Awesome game! The graphics are a bit old school but what it lacks in visual, it makes up for in enjoyment.   Basically, you are stuck on the bottom of the ocean and are trying to find pieces of your ship.. meanwhile you try to survive the ocean's depths are predators. The base is a bit cut and dry, but it still fun to play around with. Food can be difficult to come by until you get some little farms up and running. Once you put some time into it, you can really get into a nice groove and work your way to the outskirts of the map. When the main objective is complete and you know longer have a set goal it can get a bit dull, but its still fun to play around on the ocean floor!  As you can see, I spent quite a bit of time on this game and I'm sure I'll pick it up again in the future. Super fun game!
In 20 years:  Half-Life 4  Call of Duty 27  Battlefield 20  Team Fortress 5  Counter Strike: Whatever They Name It  Garry's Mod 3  Far Sky Newest Update Since 2014

The problem with this game is I beat it with the first helmet and nothing else. I didn't feel a need to craft the better equipment because there was no death penalty.  I found a droid, who would watch as my screen cracked and I exploded under pressure. He would be with me when I came back around to do it all over again. Other than being a companion, he didn't really do anything for me.  A frilled shark chased me from 100 m to 300 m as I plunged desperately for a submarine piece. This is an issue as enemies will NOT stop chasing you unless you get back to base, so if you don't have a weapon you're pretty much screwed.  The game gets the atmosphere done pretty nicely though, which I definately think is one of the stronger parts of this game. Also, the survival mode where you only have one life might provide a little challenge for people looking for a pretty difficult survival game, making each encounter with sharks and barrucadas a scary event, and harvesting potatos and fish absolutely essential.

This game has amazing potential and looks at theme not usually employed in games: underwater survival. However, despite desending to depths of roughly 350m below sea level, this game is rather shallow. Once you complete the main (and only) objective, retreiving your submarine, the game loses all it's interesting aspects. You can play it for a few hours, and then never touch it again. It just feels unfinished. It something were to happen in the future, like an update that adds more to it, it might be work playing. But at it's current state and price, I would suggest you get something else.
No way I have tried everything to get this game to run. Update everything, reinstall still not launching. Three hours and my Dads help still will not run,
its a good game BUT the devlopers just stoped working on it after green light dont buy it if you think it will get better but if you likie minecraft set underwater then buy a dirrfent game

Yes,Yes,Yes I reccomend this game it is fun and the story is short your stuck in the ocean and all you have to do is survive much like stranded deep you have to go around getting resources finding bases that have been left behind.This game gives you the option of building a decent sized base as well. There are some small drawbacks such as lack of content and a long loading time but its well worth the wait and the money buying it i do recommend waiting till it is on sale. (I have completed this game several times before getting a steam copy, so please excuse my low hour count.)  Many players critisize FarSky for a lack of content, short playtimes, and limited replayability. I do not blame them for the sentiment, though I would also argue that FarSky presents the player with a very complete and polished experience.  Though short, FarSky presents a memorable experience that sticks with the player. A heady mix of minimalistic visuals, ambient world presence, and emergent storytelling produce an unforgettable experience packed full of memorable moments.  If you have an appreciation for slower-paced games that are worth coming back to every few years, this is totally worth the asking price. If you think you might cap out at a single playthrough, it's still worth it on sale.

Standing in your base twiddling your thumbs is not very fun)   TL;DR - Underwater Survival Purgatory. meh/10

Don't get me wrong, I like the game, but it's super easy.  Mining is easy, completing it is easy, building is easy.  You start off with way too much, there's barely anything to build, and there's no reason to build the highest tier stuff for your character, because you can make it to the deepest parts without it.  If this game had a lot more content, I'd recommend it, or if it was a lot cheaper. I completed it in 90 minutes. Yes, there's still another 2 modes, but they'll be much the same, and there's no reason to build a massive base, because you can build so little.  It's an interesting idea, but not fully executed I don't think.  On a side note, the graphics are a tad bland as well...  If they brought out a lot more to craft/do, then I'd recommend it, until then, I like it, but wouldn't really recommend it, unless it was super cheap.

I'd push this game for an eight-year-old, but if you're interested in more than 6 hours of content, try something more grown-up like minecraft. I had high hopes for the underwater survival game. Hopes dashed...

Perfect. absoulutely a perfect game, exept it needs more content and things to craft, multiplayer!!!!, and MERAMAIDES!!  GET THIS GAME IF YOU LOVE GAMES so fun but it is hard

I give this game a 6 out of 10. I has great potential, but it never quite became the awesome game it should have been.  Crafting... The crafting is pretty week. You access the crafting table and choose the item you want, if you have the correct ingrediants in your inventory, the item is instantly made.   None of the items are complicated at all. Use 20 copper ore, 2 gold, and POOF, you have an underwater scooter. There is no refining of minerals, there is no crafting of smaller components to later build a more complicated item.  Also if you want to build something , but don't have the ingrediants it will show you tiny little icons of what you need, but it doesn't say what those icons are. For example I needed to make a bandage to stop my bleeding, and it needed seaweed, but the icon didn't look like seaweed and I could find anything that I was harvesting that had an icon that looked like the one shown.  One last thing about the crafting. The ore to mine is everywhere. You are litterly surrounded by it. There is more ore around you then just regular stone.  Graphics... The game looks very beautiful lots of underwater eye candy, The best part of the game is the look and feel of your surroundings.  Sound... Sound isn't too bad, but when night comes you get some fairly bad music start to play. seems like they were trying to copy minecraft here, but where mine craft music is peaceful sounding, this music doesn't give me that feeling.  The combat is also pretty week. The fish AI is basically always the same from every fish...charge at you at high speed straight on.  This game could have been so much better, but it feels like a game that is still in Alpha, but it is a finished game.
This game is like the best sea game i have ever played just buy it its amazing

Far Sky is another minecraft clone with few own ideas. These are: 1)Underwater gameplay  2)Craftable drills that mine resources for you. 3)Swimming Mule-gundrones.  Other differances are alternative versions of minecraft gameplay(Drill=Pickaxe Harpoon=Bow etc)  The crafting system has much less to offer then minecraft. In fact There are less then 40 recepies(Minecraft has almost 100 or maybe more).  The bigest problem though is the exploration, The player is always limited to maximum presure of used diving suit, What realy hurts is that one ore that is required to make better helmets for presure resistance almost always spawns in tons just a few hundred meters below the starting depth tolerance. This forced me to restart a game more times then i can count.   Another isuee is the day and night mecanic. In minecraft it was a chalange becouse monsters could find you. Under the sea though predators(Sharks are the only mob that atacks on sight) find you in about 30 seconds after nightfall,  The only thing to do is to jump yourself al the way back to your base,(No running mecanic is present and walking is limited becouse of the legendary invisible walls). And it seems inside it even a nuke couldent hit.  NPC's just circle it blainlesly. It looks nice, but after 10 minutes of night with a moran shark doing 360's around your house you just get sick of it. The only thing capable of killing during the night is death from starvation.
this game is very weak it cant keep up his self it crashed all the time

All in all a good game for under $5. That being said it could be so much more. The graphics are really nice and the ambiance completes whole feel of being underwater. Physics & combat is rather simple but for the current casual play the game offers it works. Where it lacks is gathering, crafting and building. Gather, once you get an extractor you’ll get more materials then you will ever need. Crafting could be expanded, many of the things you can build you never really need. Building stuff from chests makes crafting them unnecessary. Food options are nice but end the end I was just living potatoes. As for replay, its there. There is a Survival mode that can be challenging, for a little while. Me I will try playing it by avoiding chests and only eating fish. Andof course I can also see the charm of just building bases.  In the end, a game worth picking up, for under $5 and for the player who wants a casual survival & building game.

I had bought this game with doubts on my mind weither this would be a good game or anoher game that looks good but plays horribly.... BUT this game proved me wrong, this game is actually a whole lot of fun, ive spent close to 5 hours ALREADY and i just bought the game TODAY. theres not much to bulid but with the really beatiful ocean and ocean creatures (Nice and Enemies) this game just delivers everything it promises with buliding your own base or exploring the deep ocean floor. Hopefully they will add in a new suit where you could go down past -350 but as of right now this is perfect i def. recommend.

This game is absolutely incredible. In the short time I have played it, I have been blown away. The atmosphere this game has is amazing. I have always loved open world survivals and sandbox games like this. But this game has taken it to a new level.   My only recommendation is to introduce multiplay on this with more content. That would make it one of the best sandbox survival games out there.

Really good game, I love it.  First, I love the underwater world by my mind. But after I played this game, I love it more and more  Okay let me talk about pros and cons.   Pros. -Good survival game. Not hard to play, better than some silly survival games. -Survival mode is really challenging me, I died and start from beginning for 2-3 times but I never give up on it. -Underwater terrains in this game is really beautiful, such an amazing experiences!  Cons. -You will bored if you have everything, this game has only one main mission. Then just do what you wanna do. -Like everyone said, first night you play this game, it's f**king exciting!! But after that, umm.  I still recommend this whatever it takes, I love this game.  7 out of 10!

One of the more enjoyable indie games I've had the pleasure of playing this year. Brilliant concept and execution, and fresh take on the survival genre. Simple to play, with just enough depth (hurr durr) to keep you occupied for many hours. Several game modes to keep it fresh, including a custom game mode where you control many aspects of the game (as well as starting gear). Not sure if this will recieve a lot of updates, but I sure hope so! Easily a 10/10..

This game has a great concept. Super fun to play, but it just doesn't have enough content. It has some replayability, but you can finish the story in a few hours if you wanted to. That being said, this game is awesome, I hope the developers update it with new content.
A fun survival game if not too short.

I followed this game since it's open beta stage, when it was kind of an arena game, with bosses, etc. I must say, at every update this game only got better, and now, in it's full release, it is better than ever. One of the bad things is that this game, sadly, is very underrated.

This game had potential... yes it had. This game is cool for 2-3 hours, then it gets boring. All you have to do is to live underwater and collect parts of submarine to save yourself. On one hand the game is beautiful. On the other hand I found the game difficult to play. It's not the sharks or the plausible death by drowning. It's that the tutorial wasn't that great. I found myself wanting to go online to figure out how to play and when I learned most of my progress singularly depended on immediately finding and getting iron its appeal sunk for me....

*buys game* *Plays game*  *kill lots of fish and get lots of iron and copper* *dies*  *rage quit via alt+f4* *forgot to save* *cries* *rights review* *goes back to game* *finish the game in 20 min* *deletes old review* *makes this one* THE GAME IS SO FUN BUT SHORT :/

Fun, but a lot of bugs to the point where its very broken. The game will crash, making me and a lot more people lose progress. It has done this so many times that I've stopped playing. There are ways to avoid the crashes, but none have worked for me sadly. But if you do find away around it, get ready for fun. This game has awesome building. You can find destroyed bases in which you can repair, and use to your ability, or destroy, and get resources. But sadly, it falls a bit when you realize, there are so many useless materials. And story mode is WAY to short. Sandbox mode is fun, but can also get repetitive. But this game is a lot of fun, but I'd recommend waiting for a sale, just incase you have crashing problems and can't fix them.
got it for a $1 from humblebundle so far its ok.
got old quick and not worth $17.99 glad i got it for $5 or else i would of regretted buying this

I have a conditional yes. If you can find it for under 10$ at any point, I would go for it. It is not a 20-30$ game because all you do is collect parts for a submarine to get back to the surface. The game difficulty keeps you aware of your surroundings but the biggest challenge I faced in the beginning was getting it to run. I did two things at once so I cannot say what got it to run but it was either updating my Java or updating my gpu. If I went back in time, I would buy it again as long as it was under 10$.

This is a beautiful, unique sandbox game that stands out from the crowd with its amazing underwater setting.  The single best part of this game are the visuals. They are just plain beautiful, breathtakingly so at times. The presence of a story with an overarching goal that gives some background is a nice touch that is missing from far too many sandbox style games (even though the story in this game is completely contrived, you're only down maybe 300-400 feet yet they have no way to rescue you so you have to fix your sub...). I like the resource gathering system with automated extractors and mostly unlimited resources once you find suitable deposits.  Unfortunately, this game also has some major issues and really falls short of being a great game and ends up being merely mediocre and not worth the asking price.  First off, although the adventure mode has a basic tutorial built in, it misses some key points that sent me to the wiki to figure out how to play the game.  There's also several game mechanics more or less copied wholesale from minecraft that have no place in this game. This is a near future sci-fi game, why do I have to mine coal to cook my food!?! At night, the predators hunt you down from a mile away, but completely ignore you in the daytime. I've never seen them even try to catch any of the numerous other fish that are more appropriate for their size. At least the penalty from dying is minimal, all your stuff is put in a chest and you get a death marker so you can swim back and retrieve it.  Base building is a lot more difficult than it should be. Your base can take damage from a boss enemy, but the tool to repair the damage is the same as the removal tool, so if you accidentally click on a part that's NOT damaged it's removed and you often have to go outside the base to replace a floor panel you accidentally removed while inside.  Probably the biggest reason why I can't honestly recommend this game at the asking price is that there really isn't much content here. I played through the story for the first time with having to look through the wiki in under 2 hours, and in that time I was able to get the highest tier equipment. The simplistic base building mechanics mean that there's not really much interesting you can do as far as base building (other than trying to reach the surface by building your base up to it I guess) and the lack of multiplayer kills a lot of the replay value.  Overall, a beautiful game that sadly falls short of its potential.

It's fun but a little hard and confusing at the beginning but is still good. It could use some major bug fixes and improvements and could use a better crafting setup. All around it's good especially for Mac user's such as myself. Keep working on it and it might become popular.

Overall an enjoyable game to play. However, on a number of occasions I was left scratching my head and wondering 'what shall I do next'. The main flaw in an otherwise great game is the lack of content. In the story driven part of the game, once you collect 9/9 of your submarine pieces you can leave. This feat can be accomplished in around an hour and im sure you could do it in less if you tried. Aside from the lack of content a great game with nice visuals and predators that will cause you to, on occasion, lose your cool as you have no idea where the hell that Kraken came from.    Overall a 6/10 Would be more if there was more to do.   Would recommend only if on sale as £10.99 is a extraordinary price for a game witch I felt was worth £5.00 or less.

I seriously completed this game in about an hour and a half. Idk wtf the developer was thinking leaving a game this bland. Unless u want a super short underwater survival game DO NOT PURCHASE. you can grab all your submarine parts once u get ur first suit of armor and then u can comeplete the game by just driving to the surface, there is not much of anything to do and even less for variety, the building system is not very good or very in depth and there is no multiplayer suppoort to add to longevity.

Fun little game. During the day, relaxing, thanks to the scenery, music and sound design. At night, a bit scary, and you end up looking over your shoulder quite a bit (especially in the early game) because there could always be some kind of shark, barracuda or giant octopus right outside your field of vision. The crafting system is a bit simple, but here it works. Kind of a short game too, unless you count replays. As many have said, it's basically underwater minecraft, with one major difference I noticed: there is a definite objective beyond just surviving, and the game does have a defined ending. Well worth the price when it's on sale.
Its an extremly fun game.  They Finally Made a game that focuses on my fear of the ocean I wish there was multiplayer though :/ But All In all Great Game! 9/10

This game is pretty straightforward: Gather resources, build equipment, survive, and win. The visuals are quite pretty, atmosphere is great, but I find that the game lacks a bit in content. I played through the game in two hours, and it left me wanting a lot more equipment to craft, incentive to build your own base, further depths etc. I will recommend this game to anyone who gets it for between 1-3 dollars. 15-20 bucks is way too expensive in my opinion.
I really enjoyed this game it was very fun and relaxing. Although it is very short I enjoyed the visuals and game controls.

This game is trying to fall somewhere in between minecraft and subnautica and doesnt really do either of them very well. inventory management is completely unforgiving considering the amount of crap you are expected to carry around. the enemies in the game benefit from overwhelming speed and ferocity making it nearly impossible to deal with them in the early game, which adds to the frustration level you suffer early on. this game may some into its own in time? but for now. i simply cannot recommend it.

Game showed promise but it seems the developer gave up on it. Completed in about 2 hours taking my time to explore. There aren't really a lot of things to build so after I beat it I quickly lost interest. I can't really complain as I got it super cheap on the Humble Bundle but wish it had more variety. I'd say this is a $10 max game.

The story doesn't take very long to complete, (took me about 4.5 hours, but I did a lot of gathering and exploring) but after it is completed you can still play a sandbox mode which is just as fun. After saying that, I would try to grab the game while it's on sale as I know it is a little costly for what you get.

While I have logged quite a few hours on this game, in its current state I do not reccomend it at the current price of $9.99USD.   While Farsky is simplistic and visually pleasing, the game itself lacks content ranging from a limited map all the way to the not so wonderful ending. To avoid spoilers I won't discuss that even though there is not much to go into detail about. The game itself takes about 3-4.5 hours to complete at max if you don't really know what to do at the beginning. I have been watching this game for some time for updates but the forums are spot on about one thing: The development of this title is almost nearly abandoned.   I would reccomend this game if: ~ You buy it during the winter or summer sales ~ Like the simplistic crafting experience while dodging a small array of enemies at night ~ Need to blast a couple hours ~ Can stab fish and they explode in a cloud of blood and a fish fillet that could be lightly fried.  Why I currently do NOT reccomend this: ~ The current price of $9.99USD is overpriced for this little content ~ Nothing to do but restart the game after story completion ~ Lack of content = Lack of replayability ~ Development has ceased, no new updates coming in from the looks of it ~ Not many modes of gameplay to keep interest  Date of Review: 03/30/2016
Very fun. I really like the game. But I wish there was more.

I loved this game when it was fresh, but after 2 hours I felt like I payed WAY too much for it.  Please don't say your game is full and finished when there is barely enough content for a $5 game. much less $15. I feel very ripped off by this game and I really wish they would update it, it really needs an update.

Farsky has its ups and downs, and not just literally, this game could be considered highly immersive, for its feeling that nothing is completed. Overall the story is a great tutorial, and sandbox is easily beat. Only after a few hours playing I found my self desiring more, and searched for mods. Its graphics and overall type of game is what just made me want this as soon as I saw the trailer. This game is not perfect though for example, my sub was stuck my homes walls, and carrots have an exploit. so in conclusion this game with limited building capacity, resources, and just stuff to do makes me want to rate it 5/10. But with its ambience, graphics, music and game play I would say this game is about 7/10.

Exploration, Survival, resource gathering game. Education is an added plus, it lightly treads on sonar maps, depth diving, animal species underwater, plant species, and ecosystems. Good for children and adults. I give it a 4 out of 10 on easiness level, the easiest being a 1. But the game is more about exploration and timing oxygen tanks.
great game but has some major bugs
Fun Fun Fun..what a great concept. Needs more missions, Steam workshop would put this over the top. Hope there is more to come. Sandbox mode is cool and adds replay value. It is short !
It`s Awesome!!!

Game is good for a couple of hours of ♥♥♥♥♥ and gigs. It's a nice looking environement, with a solid sound track to boot. Game plays pretty smoothly and the oxygen mechanic will keep you on your toes, making sure that you make the most of every second you spend out of base, gathering those precious resources. Combat's what you'd expect, nothing overly spectacular. You can pretty much kill anything with the same technique. My only quarrel is that it didn't really have much to offer after you'd maxed your gear, crafted all the shiny stuff, and completed the adventure mode, which can be done quite easily in about 4-5 hours. Overall if you're looking for something that's short and sweet, fairly immersive and not overly fast paced than this game is going to be the way to go. If you're looking for something with a bit more to keep you entertained in the long run, then at the moment this probably wouldn't be the best option. Overall a good game, with a beautiful environment, enjoyable to play, though just a little limited.

FarSky is one of the most paradoxically tense and soothing games I've played in recent years.  On the one hand, the deep sea theme is beautiful and calming. The graphics are a bit chunky and aren't anything to write home about, but they get the point across without feeling cluttered and there are lots of pretty sea creatures and seascapes to look at.  At the same time, the constant pressure of the depleting air tank, Nathan the Diving Man's stomach, and all of the pretty sea creature who want to murder the heck out of you keep the game from being a walk in the park.   This is not a long game, nor is it a particularly difficult one. Taking even basic precautions should keep you from getting eaten and skilled survivor gamers will probably be able to beat both Adventure AND the more difficult Survivor mode in just a few hours. That said, if you have the money so spare and a few hours to kill, the game it definitely worth it.

Utterly fantastic!! I've been playing and re-playing this game and it's just a lot of fun. I've recommended it to all of my friends who are minecraft fans and they watched some walkthrough videos and are going to play too. Great game!!!!

Outstanding game! I am playing it on Linux Mint XFCE, and it plays great! Thank you to the publisher for making this game available on Linux and actually making sure that it works before you sold it to people.  This is not a hardcore game, but it is a very fun way to spend some time away from reallity.  Collecting gold to spend in the sandbox mode is a little strange though. But overall this is a very solid, well built game, and worth every penny.  P.S. If you are having trouble with full screen in Ubuntu, just go to options and toggle it off even if it says that it already is, then go back in and toggle it back on, and it should be in full screen mode now (A very minor glitch I ran into when I had Ubuntu installed on my laptop).

9.5/10  Upon first playing farsky with the escape being to find nine peices of a submarine,the game might seem like a quick play. But, this game in fact has a decent amount of gameplay. I have had about two hours of playing and I'm still very interested. I feel that once I finish the game I will keep play, It is that kind of game. I enjoyed what I have play as much as belive as much that I will play. It is a good all around game. Highly recommended.
It might be outdated but it lives up to date BEST GAME EVER 2014 shoutout to pikachu murderer Please buy this game......pls

Great gtame got help and fixed it than fixed it on steam. If the resolution is to high and you can't change it, right click, click properties, click betas, and opt in to the patch it will launch with the launcher allowing you to change resolutions. :D
Definitely one to check out.
Its a low spec underwater survival game that puts in the shoes of a man named nathan Its fun and easy to learn  but theres one problem Its too easy

Farsky is a fun game. There are some launching issues that I'm sure you will get, but I was able to email the devolpers and he was very nice and helpful in getting my game to launch. If your game wont launch just know that it is probably a java problem. It is a fun game and I recommend it.

This recommendation goes for the price of the game.It could be both.....no option for that  I'm an old player and i didn't had a pc when i was younger so i got used to, if i wanted a game it was always more expensive comparing to pc games. For the price it's not a bad game, you will have fun but it will feel like it is an early access and from what i have read the devs aren't going to do any kind of updates with new stuff to FarSky and that really makes a good point for not buying the game but tbh, i got it for 'free'(2,99e with money i had on the wallet it was free).  If you buy this game you will have fun but it will get bored kind quickly and the save system is so lame that will get you ♥♥♥♥♥♥.....if you wanna save you have to actually save and quit...  So...for 15e you can enjoy a few hours on a game that seams an early access, if you can get it from a weekend deal or anything like that, go for it.
i really like this game even though i have only played it for 1 hr i highly reccommend this to everyone ^_^
If you want a casual but engaging survival game filled with beauty, wonder and excitement, then give this game a try.

Hello everyone and welcome to my review. I'm going to sum up my entire review in only a few words. Those words are: Difficulty running the game. That's right I'm having an apparently common problem with this game, it will take me to the option screen where it tells me options like 'play' or even the options thing and when i click play, a small window pops up and then the entire game shuts down immediatly. I've red through the community forums about how to fix this problema and have tried every trick in the book and it seems like my specs are good enough to run the game...well they're supposed to be anyway and yet nothing works. I can't get the blasted thing to run no matter how hard I try, it was simply luck for me that i bought this game when it was on sale for 3 dollars or i'd be severly disappointed right now because this game seems like it would be fun and interesting if i could only get it to run. So there you have it my review of the game, If you are interested in playing but don't know if it will even run on your computer then please do what I did and wait for a sale that way if it doesn't run then at least you won't be too terribly heart broken because you spent good money on it.

FarSky is very simple and rather short (beat in a couple hours) but still fun and entertaining for what it is. I picked it up on the summer sale. I would reccommend picking it up on sale as I don't think the price is justified for what is in the game. It could use more content and at first I was somewhat bored but after figuring out the mechanics and how it worked it was a good time waster.

Now am I not recommending it because it's a horid game, no that's not why. Game breaking bugs that cause it to crash alot? Nope not that either, the reason I don't recommend this game is because of it's very short story mode with very little substance to it, and the fact that I can't see there being much replayability. I managed to beat the game in under an hour and played around with the side stuff and found that I really had nothing left to do, no objectives or anything of the sort other then 'survive' for a long time, or just build stuff for the sake of building it. Now this being said anyone who was into minecraft would probably enjoy this game, or other survival games that really don't have a lot of objectives and all you have to do is survive. Then this is a yes game for you. For anyone looking for a survival game with a satisfying endgoal, this isn't your game.
this game was not bad. but not worth 16.99 can   mod sport would have helped.
I really like FarSky. I feel like it shouldn't have much replay value, but I keep coming back. I think I just like the atmosphere and the gameplay enough that I don't mind the rather limited story.

I love this game! I really love sandbox and it is a really relaxing game. (When your not getting murdured by preditors...) Although I am now having alot of problems getting the game to run now. For some reason when the game loads it just crashes. I've tryed reinstaling it but it didnt work.

Awesomeness for Everyone.  Thank you Farsky Interactive for making this game that:  A) Plays as flawlessly as any major developer (better than most) B) Doesn't exclude those of us that don't want to spend $800-2000+  on a computer, just to play a GAME. C) Having the passion and creativness.  If you enjoy hunting, mining, fishing, treasure hunting, crafting and battling creatures that will kill you mercilessly, then I highly recommend this game.

I'm still only in the early stages in FarSky, but I am enjoying it immensely. Mining and crafting is a much simpler activity than other games like 7 Days to Die (which I am grateful for) and it is pretty fun to explore the ocean, while watching out for those pesky Great Whites, hammerheads, barracudas and other sea-faring meanies. It's a breath of fresh air compared to (most other games I have been playing recently- don't get me wrong, I love zombie games). It's fun, but certainly doesn't alleviate my fear of sharks. ;)
This is a very good looking game and quite enjoyable. However it is majorly lacking direction and needs a multiplayer function.

This game is actually one of my favorite suvival games because it's not like every other one. Instead of surviving zombies, robots or other players; you survive against the ocean's preditors. This game is totally worth the buy.
it wont even let me run it. Complete waste of money
Dies from hunger 99.99% of the time. Gets eaten by shark 00.01% of the time.  8/10  Needs Multiplayer / co-op mode OR third party private server support.. or even LAN support..

This is a really fun game! I would recommend this to my friends and people I know looking for a sweet crafting, and mining, and all around adventuring game. It being underwater is what is very intriguing to me. :)

First impression: The idea of the game is intriguing.  Survival game, but UNDERWATER.  I was looking for a survival game that wasn't such a horror bomb, so I found Farsky.   I've exhausted the story mode now, and I've got to say, in overall, this game is nice. It isn't anything revolutionary but it's NICE. If you're looking for a way to kill time, Farsky is a quite the pretty thing to help you with that.  The graphics ARE beautiful and unique and the sceneries throughout the game really catch your eye.   The story in the other hand isn't such a charmer, pretty much the basic stuff, BUT it fulfills it's duty. The plot works with the gameplay, so no big complaints made here. The exploration too starts to repeat itself after a while, but the game is fairly short, so this won't be a big problem either if you beat the game as I did: Basically by running it through.   The only big minus that I have for the game, is for the beginning of it. You'll really grow to enjoy this game, but at first it is very hard to get hang of ANYTHING since there is absolutely NO TUTORIAL in the game.  Yeah, one might say discovering things in games like this is point of this genre, but I think that it's a pity that there is absolutely no guidelines at all for those who have never played games like these. I am making a point here, since I was on the verge of quitting the game in my frustration at first too. I am not the kind of person that likes googling walkthrough-stuff, but then...  Who does?

I played this game for barely an hour. After getting some of the basics down, I made a brief journey outside of my base, died, and respawned.  The problem is, something appears to be up with the memory of the game. The initial base you are provided with changed every time I died. Literally, the second time I died the entry to my sub-sea base changed from a 4x4 square with a ladder, to a 2x4 rectangle with no ladder, I had no resources and no way of getting more to build the tools and workshops needed and was stranded outside of my base.  Perhaps if I play a bit longer, I might find I am being silly or ignorant, but there do seem to be some serious bugs that need to be worked out (like trying to build flooring from underneath a floor, and the floor tiles being deducted from your inventory but no sign of any floor being built), and from what I see there is no future hope of that, so I probably wont be playing this much longer.
The less version of Subnautica. It's nice, but after you complete the objective there isn't nothing to do. Buy when it's on sale, or just save the money and just go buy Subnautica.
dont buy this game,  -no updates  -like 25 items  -boring af    i hope i will help others to save their money. :) I rate this game 9/11
This game have so much fun... but, i cant save my game... why that happen to me??? T_T help me someone

Game is a Breath of Fresh Air. Collect resources to craft tech then repair bases while hunting fish for food then grow your own carrots / potatos inside sea-labs on the ocean floor. Adventure mode was fairly fun to complete in under 3 hours. Complete with one Submarine, 'Sandbox' and 'Hardcore' Mode. Negatives - No achivements.

I enjoyed it to an extent, and I say this as someone who is a fan of the genre, I returned it for only one reason: It was forgetable. It was fun, but it is just too similar to 90% of the other titles that have better graphics and a better and more rich world story.

I had a lot of fun playing this game for six and a half hours, but I don't think I'll make it to seven.  With every week marking the release of a new survival game its nice to see something different.  There are only a small amount of things to craft, and some of them are completely useless, and you find coins that serve absolutely no purpose at all.  It's fun, but once you complete the adventure mode there isn't much left to do.

While I am recommending you buy this game, I recommend you do it on sale only. This game is incredibly short, about 2-3 hours at best, 5-6 if you play through all three slightly different survival modes without rushing through them. This game in essence is like a cheaper, and worse version of subnautica, only farsky came before it. That being said I do think there's worthwhile entertainment value if it's bought at sale price. It's like a nice little underwater minecraft-ish survival game with some base building, food gathering, a decent crafting system, and somewhat entertaining combat. Though instead of combat it's more like fish rushing at you in a straight line.
i kinda like it all though i wish building the submarine wolud be easier P.s Devs
It's a great experience for a good price, but you get tired of it after a while.

It's reall well made for a first game. Visuals were so beautiful. The mechanics simple and easy to understand. My only critisism. is that there wasn't enough of the game. Most maps, modding, comunity work shop and modding would be so appriciated.
Start of the game: Wow, the ocean is so beautiful.. Later: JESUS ♥♥♥♥ING CHRIST IS THAT A KRAKEN?!

It dosnt have that much to offer. It is a very fun game though. I remember getting it on sale for 1$. It only took about 3 hours to beat but those 3 hours were great. Would prefer over subnautica. 8/10

The game lasted for under a day simply due to the lack of content. Subnautica contains far more even when being a early access game. Eventually farsky will be uninstalled and doomed to a permanent spot in your library. Not worth buying

How unfortunate. I actually got this because I WANTED a short,focused undersea game as I find I don't currently have enough time to dedicate to the much larger in scope Subnautica. Even knowing what to expect I find this game to have a massive lack of content. I completed the story mode (such as it is) in an hour and a half. This unlocked survival mode but I see no reason to play again as I had obtained everything there is to obtain in that brief 90 minute playthrough. I recall when this was in early access and it seemed promising,if not as graphically splendid as subnautica. Clearly it has been rushed and abandoned. Such a shame really.
